title: Should students be allowed to have cell phones in their classrooms? - Quora

response.answer_text: How old is the student? Here in primary school all students hand in their smartphones at the beginning of class and they are kept with the teacher on their desks until the class ends. It is there because kids play on their smartphones and is a disruption in class. They are their to learn, not look at snapchat and YouTube . In secondary school it isn't a problem as again they are there to learn and the distractions hinder their ability to learn. They are required to not have them out when in class. So should they be allowed to have them sure but they shouldn't have them out during classes and depending on the student should have enough responsibility to understand that. If they don’t then it should be confiscated until the end of class. I don’t understand you are there to learn not play around on your smartphone. There is a time and place for it and in class is not a place for it.

No, they should not. Education is complicated enough without kids having the tool in their hands to be distracted. A number of school have gone to “claiming phones” at the beginning of the day. And you know what? Kids appreciated it! In the “days of yore…” kids did not need this distraction. And when there is an event? a single line of communication is much more effective than having dozens of calls coming in with contradictory information.
